title: How to Extract Subtitles from an MKV File

steps.title: Visit https://www.nikse.dk/subtitleedit.
steps.content: Visit https://www.nikse.dk/subtitleedit . Click the link to visit the official site for Subtitle Edit, a free, open-source subtitle editor.

steps.title: Download Subtitle Edit.
steps.content: Download Subtitle Edit. Click Download latest version of Subtitle Edit to begin the download and installation process. Subtitle Edit runs on both Windows and macOS.

steps.title: Open the software.
steps.content: Open the software. Once Subtitle Edit has been installed on your computer, open the program.

steps.title: Open an MKV file.
steps.content: Open an MKV file. Navigate to File > Import subtitle from Matroshka (MKV) file . Then, find the MKV video you want to work with and select Open . The video may take a moment to load into the Subtitle Edit interface. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Save the subtitles separately.
steps.content: Save the subtitles separately. From here, it is easy to extract the subtitles from the MKV! Click Save as and then select one of the two subtitle file formats: SRT - The most popular and simple subtitle format, often referred to as SubRip. ASSA - A more advanced file format, more likely to retain complex formatting and animation. [2] X Research source The file extension for ASSA is just .ass.

steps.title: Open your subtitles separately.
steps.content: Open your subtitles separately. You can now open the SRT or ASSA file separately. Use Subtitle Edit to edit the subtitles, or add the subtitle track to a different video file .

steps.title: Visit https://www.videoproc.com/.
steps.content: Visit https://www.videoproc.com/ . VideoProc is a video enhancer and converter that offers both a paid and a free version. You can use the free trial to extract subtitles from an MKV file.

steps.title: Download VideoProc.
steps.content: Download VideoProc. Click Download Free Trial for the free version, or Buy Full License if you want to own VideoProc permanently.

steps.title: Open VideoProc and select Video.
steps.content: Open VideoProc and select Video . Run VideoProc, then look for the Video tab atop the software's interface.

steps.title: Click +Video.
steps.content: Click +Video . Then, find your MKV file and open it in VideoProc. The video may take a moment to load into VideoProc.

steps.title: Click Toolbox.
steps.content: Click Toolbox . You can find this tab at the bottom of VideoProc.

steps.title: Select Export Subtitle.
steps.content: Select Export Subtitle . Set a Start Time and End Time if you only want to extract a snippet of your video's subtitles. Then, select one of the two subtitle formats: SRT - The most popular and simple subtitle format, often referred to as SubRip. ASSA - A more advanced file format, more likely to retain complex formatting and animation. [3] X Research source The file extension for ASSA is just .ass.

steps.title: Click Run.
steps.content: Click Run . It is the large blue button in the bottom-right corner of VideoProc's interface. The extraction process will begin.

steps.title: Download MKVExtractGUI-2 at https://www.videohelp.com/software/MKVExtractGUI-2.
steps.content: Download MKVExtractGUI-2 at https://www.videohelp.com/software/MKVExtractGUI-2 . Click the link and click the blue Download text to install the software to your computer.

steps.title: Import your MKV file.
steps.content: Import your MKV file. Find your MKV file and click to import it. It will appear in MKVExtractGUI-2 with separate tracks for all audio, video, and subtitles.

steps.title: Check the box next to the subtitles you want to extract.
steps.content: Check the box next to the subtitles you want to extract.

steps.title: Click Extract.
steps.content: Click Extract . With the appropriate subtitle track selected, click Extract to save them as a separate file to your computer. The subtitles will be saved as the same file they were when embedded into your MKV file, either SRT or ASSA.
